What is the minimum period of hospital s: HOSPITALISATION means admission in a Hospital for a minimum period of 24 consecutive hours.
Are ICU charges like nursing, monitoring: ICU CHARGES means the amount charged by a Hospital towards ICU expenses; this includes expenses for ICU bed, general medical support services, monitoring devices, critical care nursing, and intensivist charges.
How can the ID card issued under this po: The I.D. CARD is issued to the Insured Person by the TPA to avail Cashless facility in the Network Hospital.
What distinguishes an acute medical cond: An acute condition is a disease, illness, or injury likely to respond quickly to medical treatment, while a chronic condition is a disease, illness, or injury lasting one or more years and requiring ongoing medical attention.
Are short-term hospital stays covered un: Treatment for ‘In-patient Care’ requires a stay of more than 24 hours, except for specified procedures where a shorter admission is possible; hospitalization is required if the treatment would have needed more than 24 hours without technology.
What is defined as an accidental injury: INJURY means accidental physical bodily harm excluding illness or disease solely and directly caused by external, violent, visible, and evident means.
What makes a treatment 'medically necess: Medically necessary treatment is a condition precedent; expenses must be reasonable and customary for the treatment, tests, medication, or stay.
What expenses are included under pre-hos: PRE-HOSPITALISATION EXPENSES means medical expenses incurred up to 30 days before hospital admission; POST-HOSPITALISATION EXPENSES means medical expenses incurred up to 60 days after discharge.
What are the ambulance service coverage: Ambulance service charges are payable only if Hospitalization expenses are admissible; the limit is specified in the Policy and/or schedule, but not exceeding the Sum Insured.
Are newborn babies automatically covered: NEW BORN BABY means baby born during the Policy Period and is cover from day 1.
What is the maximum number of deliveries: MATERNITY EXPENSES include medical treatment expenses for childbirth (including complicated deliveries and caesarean sections) incurred during Hospitalization; the maximum number is not specified.
What is the maximum limit covered under: The limit for Air Ambulance benefits is specified in the Policy and/or schedule, but not exceeding the Sum Insured.
What are the criteria for medical treatm: DOMICILIARY HOSPITALISATION means medical treatment for an illness/disease/injury which, in the normal course, would require care and treatment at a hospital but is actually taken while confined to the home under constant medical supervision.
Does the policy have a waiting period fo: Coverage is not available for pre-existing diseases, time-bound exclusions, and waiting periods.
What does the policy define as a reasona: REASONABLE AND CUSTOMARY CHARGES means the charges for services or supplies, which are the standard charges for the specific provider and consistent with the prevailing charges in the area.
How is room rent limit calculated across: The policy states that the room rent limit will be up to the limit specified in the Policy and/or schedule of the Policy, but not exceeding the Sum Insured.
Are AYUSH treatments included under the: AYUSH HOSPITAL is a healthcare facility wherein medical/surgical/para-surgical treatment and procedures and interventions are carried out by AYUSH Medical Practioner(s).
What is meant by contribution under this: CONTRIBUTION is essentially the right of an insurer to call upon other insurers liable to the same insured to share the cost of an indemnity claim on a rate able proportion of Sum Insured.
What happens if two policies cover the s: If two or more policies are taken by the insured during a period from one or more insurers, the contribution clause will apply.
What are the age eligibility criteria fo: Dependent Children (i.e. natural or legally adopted) between the ages 91 days to 18 years are covered. However, male children can be covered up to age 25 if they are bonafide regular students.
How does the insurer define 'network pro: NETWORK PROVIDER means hospitals or health care providers enlisted by an insurer, TPA or jointly by an Insurer and TPA to provide medical services to an insured by a cashless facility.
Are there any exclusions related to mate: 2.32 NEW BORN BABY means baby born during the Policy Period and is cover from day 1.
Are cosmetic or plastic surgeries covere: It covers Ophthalmic ailments arising out of trauma/ infection/ age related diseases/ foreign body removals and excludes cosmetic eye surgeries, Lasik, cost of spectacles and contact lenses.
Is outpatient (OPD) treatment covered un: 2.37 OUT-PATIENT TREATMENT is one in which the Insured visits a clinic/Hospital or associated health care provider for consultation or treatment.
Are dental treatments covered under the: 2.11 DENTAL TREATMENT means a treatment related to teeth or structures supporting teeth.
Are maternity-related expenses covered u: Maternity expenses means expenses towards lawful medical termination of pregnancy during the Policy Period.  Medical treatment expenses traceable to childbirth (including complicated deliveries) are covered if the Newborn Baby Benefit is added with an additional premium.
Is organ donor surgery covered, includin: Pre and Post Hospitalisation expenses are covered.  The policy also mentions coverage for surgical procedures.
What is the co-payment or deductible cla: Co-payment means a cost-sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that the policyholder/insured will bear a specified percentage of the admissible claim.  Deductible means a cost-sharing requirement under a health insurance policy that provides that the policyholder/insured will bear a specified amount of the admissible claim before the insurer starts paying.
Are congenital or genetic disorders incl: Congenital Anomaly refers to a condition(s) which is present since birth, and which is covered under the policy is conditional upon.  Internal and external congenital anomalies are specified.
What treatments or conditions are explic: The following are excluded: biochemical markers; episodes at least 1 month apart; other causes of neurological damage such as SLE and HIV; treatment of less than 3 days.
What optional covers are available under: The Gold Plan offers optional covers for geographical extension to SAARC countries and restoration of the sum insured (up to 50% or 100%, as chosen at policy start).  Additional premiums apply for these optional covers.
Does the policy offer a no-claim bonus o: The policy mentions a cumulative bonus and waiver of waiting periods for those who maintain their policy without a break.  However, the specific details of a no-claim bonus or cumulative discount are not provided.
Does the policy exclude treatment for in: Mental conditions associated with alcohol and drug abuse are excluded.  Treatment for alcohol, drug, or substance abuse, and its consequences, is also excluded.
Is HIV/AIDS treatment covered or exclude: The company will cover medical expenses for in-patient care and pre- and post-hospitalization expenses related to HIV infection.
Does the policy exclude coverage for war: Treatment is excluded for injuries caused by war (declared or not), war-like occurrences, invasion, acts of foreign enemies, hostilities, civil war, rebellion, revolution, insurrection, mutiny, military or usurped power, seizure, capture, arrest, restraint, and detention.
Does the policy offer a second medical o: The policy covers medical expert’s fees for a medical second opinion if the insured person is diagnosed with one of the specified major illnesses, taken either before or during treatment, provided the hospitalization claim is admissible. This coverage is available for Platinum Plan only.
What are the exclusions under the person: The company shall not be liable under the personal accident section for injuries/death due to intentional self-injury, suicide or attempted suicide, being under the influence of intoxicating liquor, engagement in aviation or ballooning, speed contests or racing (other than on foot), bungee jumping, parasailing, parachuting, ski-diving, base jumping, paragliding, hang gliding, mountain or rock climbing necessitating the use of guides or ropes, solo climbing, ice climbing, ice canoeing, scuba diving, caving, cave diving, potholing, abseiling, snowboarding, wave ski surfing, deep sea diving using hard helmet and breathing apparatus, polo, snow and ice sports, similar hazardous activities, military, air force or naval operations, or whilst mounting into, dismounting from or travelling in any aircraft other than specified.
Is there any benefit under the policy if: Yes, under the Platinum Plan, if an insured person suffers an Accident during the policy period that is the sole and direct cause of total permanent disability within 365 days from the date of the accident, the policy will pay a fixed amount of 10% of the base sum insured. This benefit is not applicable for dependent children.
Does the policy include any benefit for: Yes, the policy includes Air Ambulance Cover, available for the Platinum Plan only, which covers air ambulance cost up to 5% of the policy sum insured for life-threatening medical emergencies requiring immediate and rapid ambulance transportation to a hospital/medical center that ground transportation cannot provide. This is provided necessary medical treatment is not available at the insured person's location, it is prescribed by a medical practitioner, and is medically necessary, with the insured person being in India.
What are the implications of getting adm: Claim in respect of Cashless Access Services will be through the Company / TPA provided admission is in a network Hospital/ Nursing Home and is subject to pre admission authorization. The Company / TPA reserves the right to deny pre-authorization if the Hospital / Insured Person is unable to provide relevant information/medical details; in such circumstances denial of Cashless Access should in no way be construed as denial of liability. All documents must be duly attested by the Insured Person/Claimant for claim submission.
Which illnesses are eligible for the sec: If the Insured Person is diagnosed with one of the specified major Illnesses, the policy covers Medical Expert’s fees for a Medical Second Opinion. The major illnesses covered are: Cancer, Renal Disease, Stroke resulting in permanent symptoms, Coma, All Cardiac conditions/surgeries, Major Organ / Bone Marrow transplantation, Paralysis of limbs, Motor Neuron disease, All Brain related conditions /surgeries, and Multiple Sclerosis.
Is there any restoration of sum insured: Yes, if during the Policy Period the Sum Insured gets reduced or exhausted on account of a claim under the Policy, the Sum Insured is automatically restored to the extent of the claim amount but not exceeding the Restoration limit opted (50% / 100% of Sum Insured) at the inception of the Policy. This benefit is available only under Silver and Gold Plans.
Does the policy offer personal accident: Yes, Personal Accident coverage can be taken as an optional cover on payment of additional premium, and co-payment will not apply on this cover.
Can the policy be extended for internati: Yes, the Policy can be extended to cover Insured Persons visiting other SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Co-operation) countries - Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka. No additional premium will be charged for this extension, but the Insured Person must make a written request before leaving the country.
Does the policy cover outpatient consult: Treatment that can be and is usually taken on an Out-Patient basis is not covered; however, Pre-Hospitalization Medical Expenses for consultations, investigations, and medicines incurred up to 60 days before admission and Post-Hospitalization Medical Expenses incurred up to 90 days after discharge are covered for Inpatient, Day Care, or Domiciliary treatment.
What is the waiting period for pre-exist: Expenses related to the treatment of a pre-existing disease (PED) and its direct complications shall be excluded until the expiry of 36 months of continuous coverage after the date of inception of the first policy with insurer. In case of non-disclosure, an additional waiting period of not exceeding 4 years may be incorporated from the date the non-disclosed condition was detected. If any specified disease/procedure falls under another waiting period, the longer of the two waiting periods shall apply.
What is the procedure to raise a claim f: For planned hospitalization, notification must be given at least 48 hours prior to admission. For emergency hospitalization, notify within 24 hours of the start of hospitalization. For cashless service at a Network Hospital, notify at least 48 hours before planned treatment or within 24 hours after emergency treatment. Supporting documentation, medical records, and information must be provided within 15 days of the earlier of the request or discharge/completion of treatment, including a completed claim form, original bills, reports, diagnosis, and a detailed list of services.
Who can be covered under this family flo: The Happy Family Floater Policy can cover a newly wed spouse within 90 days of marriage or at the time of renewal, and a newborn child from day one of birth or at the time of renewal. Additionally, persons above the age of 70 years can be covered under the Silver or Gold Plan.
Is there a daily hospital cash allowance: Yes, a Daily Hospital Cash Allowance is available, payable at 0.1% of the Sum Insured per day of Hospitalization, subject to a maximum compensation for 10 days per illness, with an overall liability limited to 1.5% of the Sum Insured during the Policy Period.
Is outpatient treatment for dental or ey: Expenses incurred on Out Patient Department (OPD) are generally excluded, except for OPD benefit for Dental and Ophthalmic cover in the Platinum Plan.
How long must the policy be active befor: Maternity benefits are applicable only in the Diamond and Platinum Plan, provided the plan has been continuously in force for a period of minimum 24 months in respect of both the Insured and his/her spouse.
Is ART (Assisted Reproduction Treatment): Assisted Reproduction Treatment (ART) is covered under the Platinum plan for sub-fertility/infertility where it is proven by a specialized doctor that conception through natural process is not possible. This treatment involves in-vitro handling of human oocytes and sperm or embryos for establishing a pregnancy.
What are the conditions under which the: The policy covers in-patient hospitalization medical expenses in respect of the organ donor when the Insured Person is the recipient, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 (amended) and other applicable regulations. The organ must be for the use of the Insured Person advised to undergo transplant, and the Insured Person's claim must be admissible under the Hospitalization section. Exclusions include costs associated with organ acquisition, donor screening, and any pre and post-hospitalization medical expenses of the donor.
Is a separate benefit available if the i: Yes, a lump sum payment of 10% of the Sum Insured is payable to the Insured Person donating an organ, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 (amended) and other applicable regulations.
What percentage of expenses will the ins: Under the SILVER plan, the insured has to bear 10% of the admissible claim Amount in each and every claim.
Is there any benefit or waiver available: Yes, a Waiver of Proportionate Deduction Clause is available by paying an additional premium. This waiver means that proportionate deductions related to the room rent category will not be applied, and all related expenses will be payable as per the entitled room category.
What are the exclusions under domiciliar: The Company's liability under Domiciliary Hospitalization Benefit is restricted for conditions including Epilepsy, Hypertension, Influenza, Cough and Cold, Pyrexia of unknown origin for less than 10 days, Tonsillitis and Upper Respiratory Tract infection including Laryngitis and Pharyngitis, and Arthritis, Gout and Rheumatism.
Is treatment for dog bites covered, and: Treatment for dog bites (or bites of any other rabid animal like monkey, cat etc.) is covered, with a maximum of Rs. 5,000/- actually incurred on immunization injections in any one Policy Period. This benefit is part of Domiciliary Hospitalization limits.
Are pre-existing diseases covered immedi: No, pre-existing diseases are not covered immediately after the policy starts. Coverage is subject to a waiting period of 36 months from the effective date of the policy and declaration at the time of application and acceptance by the insurer.
Can insured persons claim OPD expenses u: Generally, expenses incurred on Out Patient Department (OPD) are excluded, except for an OPD benefit for Dental and Ophthalmic cover in the Platinum Plan.
What expenses are not covered if the ins: Expenses incurred towards treatment in any hospital or by any Medical Practitioner or any other provider specifically excluded by the Insurer and disclosed on its website/notified to policy holders are not admissible. However, in life-threatening situations or following an accident, expenses up to the stage of stabilization are payable.
Is there any maximum entry age for famil: The maximum entry age for all members under this plan is 65 years. However, a Policy covering any person above the age of 70 years cannot change plans, and persons 70 years of age can be covered under Silver or Gold Plan, but not under Diamond and Platinum Plan, with a co-payment applied in all subsequent renewals.
What is the benefit payable if the insur: Under the Personal Accident Cover, if the Insured Person dies due to an accidental bodily injury within 12 months of its occurrence, the Company undertakes to pay 100% of the Capital Sum Insured (CSI).
Can the policyholder claim telemedicine: Yes, telemedicine consultation charges are allowed in the terms and conditions of the policy contract, subject to limits/sub-limits prescribed in the Policy Schedule and compliance with Telemedicine Practice Guidelines.
What amount is reimbursed for telemedici: The limit of the amount payable for telemedicine consultations is a maximum of Rs. 2,000/- per family, for a policy period.
How is chronic kidney failure defined an: Chronic Kidney disease is defined as End stage renal disease presenting as chronic irreversible failure of both kidneys to function, as a result of which either regular renal dialysis (hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis) is instituted or renal transplantation is carried out. Diagnosis must be confirmed by a specialist Medical Practitioner.
Are modern treatments like robotic surge: Yes, Robotic surgeries are covered with limits of 10% of Sum Insured, subject to a maximum of INR 1,00,000 or INR 2,00,000 per policy period. Stem cell therapy is covered only for Hematopoietic stem cells for bone marrow transplant for hematological conditions, with limits of 10% of Sum Insured, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000 or INR 1,50,000 per policy period.
What are the defined sub-limits for oral: For Oral chemotherapy, the sub-limit is 25% of the Sum Insured, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000 or up to INR 1,50,000 per policy period. For Immunotherapy (Monoclonal Antibody to be given as injection), the sub-limit is 10% of the Sum Insured, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000 or INR 1,50,000 per policy period.
What is covered under the critical illne: The Platinum plan provides a 'Life Hardship Survival Benefit Plan' for any of the 11 critical illnesses defined in the policy. If an Insured Person is diagnosed with one of these illnesses and a claim is admissible, a survival benefit becomes payable.
How many critical illnesses are covered: There are 11 critical illnesses covered for the life hardship survival benefit.
What is the minimum duration of hospital: For inpatient care treatment, the Insured Person has to stay in a Hospital for more than 24 hours. However, a relaxation to 24 hours minimum duration for Hospitalization is allowed for day care procedures/surgeries.
Are ICU expenses, including specialist c: ICU (Intensive Care Unit) charges include expenses for ICU bed, general medical support services, monitoring devices, critical care nursing, and intensivist charges. All related expenses are payable as per the entitled room category based on the Room Rent/ICU limit, and proportionate deductions related to the room rent category can be waived by paying an additional premium.
What is the scope of the cashless treatm: Cashless facility means direct payments by the insurer to the network provider for the costs of treatment undergone by the insured, in accordance with policy terms and conditions, to the extent pre-authorization is approved. This facility is available through network hospitals and is subject to pre-admission authorization based on eligibility verification and provision of relevant medical details.
What are the conditions under which pre-: Coverage for any pre-existing disease is available after the expiry of 36 months, subject to it being declared at the time of application and accepted by the insurer. Renewal and migration provisions also allow for gaining credit for pre-existing diseases, contributing to continuous coverage.
What is the waiting period for critical: Expenses related to listed conditions, surgeries/treatments are excluded until the expiry of a specified waiting period of continuous coverage. If a specified disease/procedure falls under the waiting period for pre-existing diseases, the longer of the two waiting periods shall apply. There is also a general 30-day waiting period for any illness from the first policy commencement date, except for claims arising due to an accident.
Does the policy offer coverage from day: Yes, the Policy covers a New Born Baby from day one only on payment of requisite premium. Medical expenses incurred for treatment taken in Hospital as an in-patient shall be payable, subject to policy terms and conditions. If a claim is spread over two Policy Periods, the aggregate liability is limited to the Sum Insured of the Policy under which the claim was reported.
How does the co-payment clause apply und: For Insured Persons 70 years of age or older covered under the Silver Plan, co-payment will apply in all subsequent renewals. A waiver of any terms, provisions, conditions, and endorsements of this Policy is not valid unless made in writing and signed by an authorized official of the Company.
Are maternity expenses covered, and what: Medical treatment expenses traceable to childbirth (including complicated deliveries and cesarean sections) and expenses towards miscarriage (unless due to an accident) and lawful medical termination of pregnancy are generally excluded, except for ectopic pregnancy. However, this exclusion does not apply for Diamond and Platinum plans. The company’s maximum liability per delivery or termination is limited to 2.5% of the Sum Insured in any one Policy Period.
Is assisted reproduction treatment (ART): Yes, Assisted Reproduction Treatment (ART) is included and will be reimbursed for sub-fertility/infertility. It must be proven by a specialized doctor that it is not possible to conceive through natural process due to established sub-fertility/infertility problems of the couple.
What is the financial benefit if the ins: A lump sum payment of 10% of the Sum Insured is payable to the Insured Person donating an organ to cover medical and other incidental expenses, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994 (amended) and any other applicable regulations.
Are expenses related to the organ donor: Yes, the Policy covers in-patient Hospitalization Medical expenses in respect of the organ donor when the Insured Person is the recipient, provided the donation conforms to the Transplantation of Human Organs Act 1994, the organ is for the Insured Person, and the Insured Person's claim is admissible under the Hospitalization section. Excluded costs include organ acquisition, donor screening, and any pre and post-hospitalization medical expenses of the donor.
What is the total daily limit and maximu: The daily hospital cash allowance is 0.1% of the Sum Insured per day of Hospitalization, subject to a maximum compensation for 10 days per illness. The overall liability of the Company during the Policy Period will be limited to 1.5% of the Sum Insured.
Are ambulance charges reimbursed, and wh: Ambulance service charges are reimbursed. For some plans (likely Silver/Gold), the limit is Rs.1000 maximum per illness and 1% of Sum Insured per policy period, subject to a maximum of Rs.3000. For other plans (likely Diamond/Platinum), the limit is Rs.2000 maximum per illness and 1% of Sum Insured per policy period, subject to a maximum of Rs.6000.
Can expenses incurred before or after ho: Yes, medical expenses incurred 30 days prior to Hospitalization and up to 60 days post Hospitalization can be claimed as Pre and Post Hospitalization expenses.
Is mental illness covered under any plan: Mental conditions associated with the abuse of alcohol and drugs, mental retardation and associated complications, and psychological counseling or psychotherapy not requiring hospitalization are excluded. Treatment for alcoholic/drug/substance abuse or any addictive condition and its consequences are also excluded.
Does the policy cover modern medical tec: Yes, the policy covers Stem cell therapy for Hematopoietic stem cells for bone marrow transplant for hematological conditions, subject to limits of 10% of SI, up to INR 50,000 or INR 1,50,000 per policy period. Other Stem Cell Surgery is excluded. Modern treatment methods like robotics have a sub-limit on associated expenses, indicating coverage over and above the limit for conventional surgery.
Are outpatient dental and ophthalmic exp: Any expenses incurred on Out Patient Department (OPD) are generally excluded, except for an OPD benefit for Dental and Ophthalmic cover in the Platinum Plan. Dental treatment is excluded unless necessitated due to an Injury.
Does the Platinum Plan include coverage: Yes, the Platinum Plan includes coverage for a Life Hardship Survival Benefit Plan. If an Insured Person is diagnosed with any of the 11 critical Illnesses defined in the policy (not specified in the clause) and a claim is admissible, a survival benefit becomes payable. This coverage is exclusive to the Platinum Plan.
How does the restoration of sum insured: If the Sum Insured gets reduced or exhausted due to a claim during the Policy Period, it is automatically restored to the extent of the claim amount, not exceeding the Restoration limit opted (50% or 100% of Sum Insured).
What expenses are included under air amb: Air ambulance coverage is available for life-threatening medical emergency conditions that require immediate and rapid ambulance transportation to a hospital/medical center when ground transportation cannot provide it, necessary medical treatment is unavailable at the insured person's location at the time of emergency, and it is prescribed by a Medical Practitioner and medically necessary. The provided clauses do not specify which plans are eligible.
Are there any exclusions related to self: Under the Personal Accident section, intentional self-injury, suicide or attempted suicide are excluded. Engagement in aviation or ballooning, speed contests or racing (other than on foot), bungee jumping, parasailing, parachuting, ski-diving, BASE jumping, paragliding, hang gliding, mountain or rock climbing necessitating the use of guides or ropes, solo climbing, ice climbing, ice canoeing, scuba diving, Caving, cave diving, potholing, abseiling, snowboarding, wave ski surfing, and deep sea diving using hard helmet and breathing apparatus are also excluded.
What percentage of coverage is provided: For accidental death, 100% of CSI (Covered Sum Insured) is payable. For loss of two entire limbs, or sight of two eyes, or one entire limb and sight of one eye, 100% of CSI is payable. For loss of one entire limb or sight of one eye, 50% of CSI is payable. For permanent total disablement, 100% of CSI is payable.
How is a chronic condition defined in th: A chronic condition is defined as a disease, illness, or injury that needs ongoing or long-term monitoring through consultations, examinations, check-ups, and/or tests; needs ongoing or long-term control or relief of symptoms; or requires rehabilitation for the patient or for the patient to be specially trained to cope with it. The clauses do not detail how this definition affects long-term coverage eligibility.
What are the financial and documentation: The Policy covers Medical Expert’s fees for a second opinion if the Insured Person is diagnosed with one of the specified major Illnesses. A claim under this clause is admissible subject to the hospitalization claim being admissible, and this expense is payable only once per Illness per Insured Person.
What constitutes a medically necessary t: Medically Necessary Treatment means any treatment, tests, medication, or stay in hospital or part of a stay in hospital which is prescribed by a Medical Practitioner, is medically necessary, and is for a life-threatening medical emergency requiring rapid ambulance transportation where ground transport is insufficient, or when necessary medical treatment is unavailable at the insured person's location. For it to be considered a medical necessity, it must be certified by the attending Medical Practitioner to remove a direct and immediate health risk to the insured.
Can policyholders migrate to another pol: Migration means the right accorded to health insurance policyholders (including all members under family cover and members of group health insurance policy) to transfer the credit gained for pre-existing conditions and time-bound exclusions with the same insurer.
What is the maximum age for entry and re: The maximum entry age for all members for all plans is 65 years. However, persons 70 years of age can also be covered under Silver or Gold Plans (but not Diamond and Platinum Plans), with co-payment applicable in all subsequent renewals. Change of Plan is not allowed for a policy covering any person above the age of 70 years.
Are expenses incurred at a hospital not: Expenses incurred towards treatment in any hospital or by any Medical Practitioner or any other provider specifically excluded by the Insurer are not admissible. However, in case of life threatening situations or following an accident, expenses up to the stage of stabilization are payable but not the complete claim.
How does the insurer define contribution: CONTRIBUTION is essentially the right of an insurer to call upon other insurers liable to the same insured to share the cost of an indemnity claim on a rate able proportion of Sum Insured. The contribution clause is not applicable if the cover/benefit offered is fixed in nature or does not have any relation to the treatment costs.
Does the policy cover outpatient telemed: Yes, telemedicine consultations are covered, subject to Limits/Sub limits prescribed in the Policy Schedule. The limit of amount payable for telemedicine is maximum Rs. 2,000/- per family, for a policy period.
What benefits are available for the trea: For treatment of dog bite (or bite of any other rabid animal like monkey, cat etc.), a maximum of Rs. 5,000/- actually incurred on immunization injections is covered in any one Policy Period. This will be part of Domiciliary Hospitalization limits, and Anti Rabies Vaccination is specifically provided for.
Are immunotherapy and oral chemotherapy: Oral chemotherapy is covered per policy period at 25% of SI, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000, or up to INR 1,50,000. Immunotherapy-Monoclonal Antibody (given as injection) is covered per policy period at 10% of SI, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000, or up to INR 1,50,000.
Does the policy offer geographical cover: Yes, the policy can be extended to cover Insured Persons visiting other SAARC countries (Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, Sri Lanka) without additional premium, by making a written request before leaving the country. Cashless service is not available for treatment taken in countries outside India; such claims shall be considered only on re-imbursement basis.
Are policyholders allowed to change thei: Yes, if the family size increases on renewal, Sum Insured can be increased to maximum two slabs higher. If no claims are reported in the two immediate preceding Policy Periods, a change to the next Plan (e.g., Silver to Gold) at the initial SI slab or two steps higher from the current SI is allowed. Change of Plan is not allowed for a Policy covering any person above the age of 70 years.
Is there any penalty for non-disclosure: Coverage under the policy after 36 months for any pre-existing disease is subject to it being declared at the time of application and accepted by the insurer. The clauses do not explicitly mention a penalty for non-disclosure beyond the condition for coverage.
What types of room upgrades or hospital: Proportionate deductions in claim amounts may result if the Insured Person is admitted in a hospital room where the room category or the Room Rent incurred is higher than the eligibility specified in the Policy Schedule/Certificate of Insurance.
Can personal accident coverage be added: Yes, Personal Accident Cover (Worldwide) is available. It covers accidental death (100% of CSI), loss of two entire limbs, sight of two eyes, or one entire limb and sight of one eye (100% of CSI), loss of one entire limb or sight of one eye (50% of CSI), and permanent total disablement (100% of CSI), resulting solely and directly from sudden, unforeseen, and involuntary events within 12 months.
Does the policy allow claims for both or: Yes, the policy covers in-patient Hospitalization Medical expenses for the organ donor when the Insured Person is the recipient, provided the donation conforms to relevant acts and the recipient's claim is admissible. Separately, a lump sum payment of 10% of Sum Insured is payable to the Insured Person donating an organ, provided the donation conforms to relevant acts and the policy has been in force for at least 12 months for the donor.
What exclusions are applicable to HIV/AI: The Company shall indemnify the Hospital or the Insured the Medical Expenses for In-Patient Care, Pre and Post Hospitalization Expenses related to HIV infection. No specific exclusions applicable to HIV/AIDS-related treatment are listed in the provided clauses.
How are AYUSH (Ayurveda, Yoga, Unani, Si: The Company shall indemnify medical expenses incurred for inpatient care treatment under Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homeopathy systems of medicines up to the limit of sum insured in any AYUSH Hospital. However, massages, steam bath, and other alternative or AYUSH treatments (other than Ayurveda and Homeopathy) are excluded.
Does the policy provide any automatic re: Yes, a grace period of 30 days is allowed in the event of delay in renewal of the Policy. No coverage is available during the grace period, and any disease/Injury contracted during this break period will not be covered and treated as Pre-existing disease. This grace period helps treat the renewal as continuous for gaining credit for pre-existing diseases and waiting periods.
How are claims handled when hospitalizat: If hospitalization happens outside the network hospital list, cashless access services are not available. In such cases, the Insured Person may obtain the treatment and later submit the full claim papers to the Company/TPA within 15 days of discharge from the Hospital for consideration.
What is the role of the TPA in the claim: The TPA issues the ID card to the Insured Person, which is used solely to avail Cashless facility in a Network Hospital. Upon policy cancellation or non-renewal, all ID cards must be immediately returned to the TPA at the insured’s expense.
Under what circumstances can the insurer: The Company / TPA reserves the right to deny pre-authorization in case the Hospital / Insured Person is unable to provide the relevant information/medical details as required by the Company/ TPA. In such circumstances denial of Cashless Access should in no way be construed as denial of liability.
What is the impact on claim admissibilit: If the Insured Person is admitted in a room where the room category or the Room Rent incurred is higher than the eligibility, then the Policyholder/ Insured Person shall bear a ratable proportion of the expenses. Proportionate deductions related to the room rent category can be waived by paying an additional premium.
How does the policy define the principle: CONTRIBUTION is essentially the right of an insurer to call upon other insurers liable to the same insured to share the cost of an indemnity claim on a rate able proportion of Sum Insured. If two or more policies are taken by the insured from one or more insurers, the contribution clause shall not be applicable where the cover/benefit offered is fixed in nature or does not have any relation to the treatment costs.
In cases where hospitalization expenses: In cases where a claim for a New Born Baby is spread over two Policy Periods, the aggregate liability of the Company for all claims in respect of the New Born Baby shall be limited to the Sum Insured of the Policy under which the claim was reported.
What clauses apply to coverage for treat: Coverage for any pre-existing disease is subject to it being declared at the time of application and accepted by the insurer. If any false statement or declaration is made or used in support of a claim, all benefits under the policy shall be forfeited.

Are congenital anomalies \u2014 external: Internal Congenital Anomaly is defined as a condition not in the visible and accessible parts of the body, and External Congenital Anomaly is defined as a condition in the visible and accessible parts of the body. Under what conditions are telemedicine c: Telemedicine consultations are reimbursed if they are in compliance with the Telemedicine Practice Guidelines dated March 25, 2020, by MCI and as amended from time to time, and are subject to limits/sub-limits prescribed in the Policy Schedule. What are the limits and conditions for a: For ambulance services, the limits are: Per Illness - Rs.1000 maximum & Per policy period 1% of Sum Insured, Subject to maximum Rs.3000, or Per Illness - Rs.2000 maximum & Per policy period 1% of Sum Insured, Subject to maximum Rs.6000. How is the daily hospital cash allowance: The Daily Hospital Cash Allowance is 0.1% of the Sum Insured per day of Hospitalization, subject to a maximum compensation for 10 days per illness, and the overall liability of the Company during the Policy Period is limited to 1.5% of the Sum Insured. Are mental health conditions, including: Mental illness cover indemnifies medical expenses, including pre and post hospitalization expenses, under certain conditions: for illnesses covered under the definition of mental illness, hospitalization in a Mental Health Establishment, and hospitalization as advised by a Mental Health Professional. How are expenses for oral chemotherapy o: For Oral chemotherapy, expenses are covered per policy period 25% of SI, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000 or up to INR 1,50,000. For Immunotherapy- Monoclonal Antibody given as an injection, expenses are covered per policy period 10% of SI, subject to a maximum of INR 50,000 or INR 1,50,000.
How is 'medically necessary treatment' d: Medically Necessary Treatment means any treatment, tests, medication, or stay in hospital or part of a stay in hospital. For a treatment to be considered a medical necessity, it must be certified by the attending Medical Practitioner and be prescribed as medically necessary.
